Posted: April 24, 2014
												The best Jedi Knight game, not because it's the last or anything like that.This game truly is amazing, lots of mods for it like movie battles and KOTF which bring tons of new features to the game making it more fun to play both singleplayer and multiplayer.As for the singleplayer story mode, getting to create your character and start your adventure on becoming a jedi and learning the ways of the force.(SPOILER ALERT!) As well as being able to choose the dark side later on eventually.The game has 3 chapters in total where you can complete 5 missions each to unlock a new one to progress further on and eventually get into an epic boss battle.The multiplayer has lots of gamemodes and ones that are seen in many games such as FFA,TDM,CTF as well as having original ones like Power Duel having to face a sith as a jedi with an npc or with a friend and having to defeat that sith together (Like in Episode 3 Obi-Wan and Anakin Vs Dooku)Setting out on a journey, being in a jedi academy.As a star wars fan why wouldn't you like this? Unless you prefer a different gameplay style of course, though this is definitely a recommendation for all star wars fans who haven't played this and also for non fans!

Posted: April 7, 2014
												A must play for Star Wars fans. Picture Force Unleashed but with a less powerful main character (who you can customize), more realistic lightsaber duels, FPS elements, and amazing multiplayer. This game has a good story, good gameplay, and really makes you feel like you are a Force-sensitive learning the ways of the Force and becoming a Jedi (or Sith if you dare). If you love amazing action and a good story then this will probably feel like a slightly dumbed down version of Force Unleased. But while the story and action isn't as big as TFU the gameplay and RPG elements make up for it. 9/10 any day.

												I bought this for christmas, and spent most of the day playing it. This game is 12 years old, and it is the best lightsaber mechanics I hae ever seen. Movement can be clunky at times, and some of the quests are a little contrived, but it is still a fantastic game.

Posted: December 28, 2015
												Huge nostalgia trip!When I stumbled across this in steam it brought back a wave of memories , back when I was 11 or 12 and used to play the demo of this game on my dad's computer. I bought it on steam, expecting it to be not as good as a I remembered, as are a lot of my childhood games I go back to. However I was hugely surprised to find it every bit as good as I remembered. Graphics arent half bad given their age, lightsaber combat is fun and fairly varied, force powers are useful and satisfying, maps are well laid out. All in all a pretty decent game. My only complaints are lack of compass or mini map means it often takes ages to figure out where you're meant to be going, and after a while the earlier missions get a tad repetitive, combined with the very slow and sparse story telling. The story/plot is the weakest aspect of the game, but its still great fun for a light saber hacky slashy trip down memory lane.Having just completed both endings I now find myself unwilling to leave the star wars universe just yet, so am presently downloading KOTOR :)Definitely worth a play if you are even vaguely interested in star wars, as I'm not a massive fan but still enjoyed it a lot.Graphics: 7/10Story: 5/10Gameplay: 9/10Sound: 9/10Replayability: 6:10Overall mark: 8/10

Posted: April 2
												Allright I think i can actually write a review on this game, but not specifically the base game but that as well as what you should buy this game for....and that is Movie Battles 2.Okay so the base game is great i played it a ton as a kid on my xbox and replayed it on the pc if you want a true star wars game look no further because this game really gets it right.From all your favorite force powers to the dual-bladed lightsaber JKA really gives you all you need to feel like a jedi/dark jedi with a decent story to back it with a few choices, choices were rare for games like this back in the day.(KotoR is an RPG it's different)Although it seems it bit dated i feel it holds up and it's alot more fun then some of today's AAA titles. In Base the saber system is a tad bit ridiculous.You kinda just run around and swing,jump,and whatever like yoda in ep 3.But........................................................................................................................................................................................When you download Movie Battles 2 the game drastically changes.The mod is a multiplayer mod that has tons of maps(all have it's own unique objective),7 classes on each side Rebellion/Republic vs Empire/CIS obviously(Soldier which is shared, Elite Trooper/Commander again bascially the same with 1 weapon difference, Jedi/Sith have force power differences, Wookie/SBD Wookies are tanks that can punch the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of anything and SBDs just have firepower and a slap for countering jedi, BountyHunter/Hero Sniping classes few weapon differences, The 4 most distinct classes are the Clone Trooper and ARC Trooper for rebs/Mandolorian and Droideka for the imps.).Hey remember that better saber system i mentioned earlier?Well it's a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton better in Movier Battles 2 it has a learning curve and can be aggravating at first but once you learn the dueling it's so fun and competitive.After over 600 hours of mostly the mod i still suck compared to alot of other duelists in the game who have been playing since the mods release which wasnt like after the games realease like 13-14 years ago.Luckily this game is cheap to boot but its really cheap on sale it usually drops to a buck on steam, or it's in a humble bundle alot Humble Bundlers(newbs basically) as we call them have become more apparent then ever so it's a decent time to get the game and learn by wrecking people on your same skill level(though i recommend fighting people who are better as well as it will help you get better..i know it sounds a little stupid but this game is kinda stupid) It also has a full authentic mode which has map specific classes to mirror the movies and games.What are you waiting for this is probably the best Star Wars experience a fanboy could ♥♥♥♥ in his pants for.
